metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18584 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In mspack/cab.h in libmspack before 0.8alpha and cabextract before 1.8, the CAB block input buffer is one byte too small for the maximal Quantum block, leading to an out-of-bounds write. It was discovered that cabextract incorrectly handled certain malformed CAB files. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause cabextract to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cabextract - 1.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

clamav - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-base - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-daemon - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-milter - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
libclamav7 - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

libmspack0 - 0.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> We released clamav 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1X.04.2 for precise/esm and trusty, but subsequently were notified the bundled libmspack is not actually vulnerable in this case, as the version of libmspack provided had increased the CAB_BLOCKMAX macro to 65535, meaning that CAB_INPUTMAX is now 71679, which is impossible to encode in the 16-bit cfdata_CompressedSize field of a single block.

criterions.comment: cabextract package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4-4ubuntu0.1~esm1').
clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2').
libmspack package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
